thread.title: Penn State running back Saquon Barkley rebounds from early struggles
thread.title_full: Penn State running back Saquon Barkley rebounds from early struggles - The Morning Call

author: Mark Wogenrich
title: Penn State running back Saquon Barkley rebounds from early struggles
text:
BALTIMORE — Penn State running back Saquon Barkley apologized after his second fumble Saturday, promising it wouldn't happen again. He also didn't let it linger, something that impressed his older teammates.
"Some guys can put their heads down and get discouraged and totally take themselves out of the game after a mistake," offensive lineman Angelo Mangiro said. "He didn't do that. He said he would make it up to us, and he did."
Barkley made his first start for Penn State on Saturday in a 31-30 win over Maryland. It also was the toughest game of his career. The freshman from Whitehall High carried 20 times for 65 yards, a 3.2 yard-per-carry average well below his season average of 8.3. Maryland's stacked defensive fronts created little running space.
Barkley also fumbled twice, losing one at the Penn State 31-yard line. Maryland converted the turnover into a field goal to take a 10-7 lead.
The Penn State report card: Maryland edition OFFENSE: B-. Sloppy though they were, Lions deserve credit for taking (and hitting) so many plays downfield. Receiver Chris Godwin is a budding star.
DEFENSE: B-. Sloppy though they were, Lions shut down Terps four times in 4th quarter with the game on the line.
SPECIAL TEAMS: C. Punter Daniel...
OFFENSE: B-. Sloppy though they were, Lions deserve credit for taking (and hitting) so many plays downfield. Receiver Chris Godwin is a budding star.
DEFENSE: B-. Sloppy though they were, Lions shut down Terps four times in 4th quarter with the game on the line.
SPECIAL TEAMS: C. Punter Daniel...
Read the story The fumble resulted primarily from an inexact exchange, but Barkley still accepted responsibility. On the sideline, he assured teammates he would make up for it.
After skipping the next series, Barkley returned to run several times out of the Wildcat formation. He had 43 of his rushing yards in the second half, helping produce two touchdown drives.
"Saquon bounced back and owned up to his mistake," Mangiro said. "He showed a lot of maturity for a young guy."
PHOTO GALLERY: Penn State outlasts Maryland 31-30 in wild Big Ten game
DEFENDING ELLIS: Maryland quarterback Perry Ellis rushed for a game-high 124 yards and a touchdown, keeping the offense moving much of the day. But he also turned over the ball four times, with a fumble and three interceptions.
Penn State's defenders called Ellis exhausting to defend, particularly when he tucked and ran on Maryland's third-quarter scoring drives. Ellis converted three third downs and threw a touchdown pass that gave Maryland a 27-24 lead.
"That guy's a great runner," Penn State's Anthony Zettel said. "We took a lot of shots at him, hit him as hard as we could, but he just kept getting up."
RISK/REWARD: Penn State coach James Franklin said he was impressed with Maryland's defensive game plan, which marinated during the bye week.
The Terps went "high-risk, high-reward" by challenging Penn State's run game and leaving the game to a cornerback/receiver contest. Players said that Maryland had used those looks before but never in such a saturated way.
"Basically, they said your receivers won't beat us," Franklin said. "But we made big plays."
The Penn State postgame: Maryland edition Mark Wogenrich Complain all you want, but Penn State wasn't about to join. The Lions were in a celebratory mood following their 31-30 win over Maryland.
Sure...
... the defense allowed a season-high 466 yards, including 124 on the ground to Maryland quarterback Perry Hills.
... the offense rushed for a season-low...

(Mark Wogenrich) NOTEWORTHY: Penn State shifted its offensive line, moving center Angelo Mangiro to guard and starting Wendy Laurent at center for the first time. Franklin said that Brendan Mahon, who did not start for the first time this season, did an admirable job in place of right tackle Mangiro, who was injured during the game. … Cornerback Grant Haley made his second interception of the season. Trevor Williams and Malik Golden also had interceptions. … The Lions had four sacks, marking their 30 t h consecutive game with at least one.
